thread.title: Local sports digest: Stanford water polo star nears career records
thread.title_full: Local sports digest: Stanford water polo star nears career records

author: Bay Area News Group
title: Local sports digest: Stanford water polo star nears career records
text:
Local sports digest: Stanford water polo star nears career records Bay Area News Group Posted: 10/25/2015 08:23:03 PM PDT Updated: 10/25/2015 09:00:53 PM PDT Hat tricks from Bret Bonanni, Cody Smith and Kyle Weikert carried No. 5 Stanford to a 17-4 win over host San Jose State in men's water polo Sunday. 
Bonanni, a senior, now has 331 goals for his career and is one shy of tying the Stanford and Mountain Pacific Sports Federation record held by Tony Azevedo (2001-04). 
The Cardinal improved to 16-6, 2-3 MPSF with the win. The Spartans fell to 3-19, 0-6. 
Johnny Hooper scored a career-high seven goals and fellow freshman Odysseas Masmanidis scored the game-winner in double overtime as No. 3 Cal edged No. 8 Long Beach State 15-14 in Long Beach. 
The win is Cal's third double-overtime victory this season and moves the Bears to 17-4 overall and 3-1 in MPSF play. Colin Mulcahy added three goals. 
Will Grant and Graham McClone each had four goals as No. 16 Santa Clara beat No. 13 Bucknell 12-8. The Broncos (9-15) closed out their own Rodeo Tournament winning four of five, with three wins coming against top-20 teams. Football Cal's game against USC on Saturday at Memorial Stadium will kick off at noon, the Pac-12 Conference announced. The game will air on Fox. 
Cal (5-2, 2-2) has lost 11 straight games to USC (4-3, 2-2), which delivered its most impressive performance of a tumultuous season Saturday with a 42-24 thrashing of No. 3 Utah. Women's soccer Advertisement Jordan DiBiasi, Haley Rosen and Alana Cook scored second-half goals in a span of less than 16 minutes to propel No. 4 Stanford (14-2, 8-0 Pac-12) to a 3-0 win over Washington in rainy Seattle. 
Karly Graf scored her first goal of the season in the 56th minute to give No. 14 Cal (12-4-2, 5-3-0 Pac-12) a 1-0 win over No. 25 Washington State in Pullman. Emily Boyd had five saves for her 10th shutout of the season, one shy of tying the school record set by Karen Cook in 1996. 
Goals by Dorthe Hoppius and Rachel Docherty lifted San Jose State to a 2-0 win over visiting Nevada. The win clinches the Spartans (9-7-2, 7-3-0) a berth in the Mountain West championship tournament Nov. 3-7. Men's soccer Jose Carrera-Garcia had two goals and an assist as Cal beat UCLA 4-3 at Edwards Stadium. Trevor Haberkorn and Spencer Held also scored for the Bears (7-5-2, 2-3-2 Pac-12). 
Jonathan Colunga scored his ninth goal of the season as San Jose State (5-9-1, 3-3-1 Western Athletic Conference) played to a 1-1 tie with visiting Air Force. Tennis Stanford's Taylor Davidson and Caroline Doyle advanced to the main draw singles semifinals of the women's USTA/ITA Northwest Regional Championships at Taube Family Tennis Stadium. 
Davidson defeated Cal's Karla Popovic 6-4, 6-4, and Doyle beat Andrea Ka of USF 3-6, 7-5, 6-2. 
Stanford's David Wilczynski, the No. 5 seed, beat top-seeded Florian Lakat of Cal 6-2, 6-4 to advance to the semifinals at the men's USTA/ITA Northwest Regional Championships in Seattle. Volleyball Lillian Schonewise registered 13 kills and four blocks to lead host Cal (8-13, 2-8 Pac-12) to a 28-26, 25-19, 26-24 win over Washington State. Men's golf San Jose State's Cody Blick and Saint Mary's Jonathan De Los Reyes finished tied for third at the Price's Give 'Em Five Invitational in El Paso, Texas. 
De Los Reyes closed with a 5-under-par 67 for a three-round total of 205 at Butterfield Trail golf course. His efforts led a final-day charge by the Gaels, who jumped three spots to finish second in the 15-team field, 11 strokes behind champion Kansas. 
Blick closed with a 2-under 70 as San Jose State placed 11th. Women's golf My Leander set a school record with a round of 65, and Elizabeth Schultz shot a 66 as the San Jose State teammates held the top two spots after one round of the Las Vegas Collegiate Showdown at Boulder Creek Golf Club in Boulder City, Nevada. The Spartans are tied for first with Michigan at 13-under 275. 
Santa Clara placed third among 11 teams at Cal Poly's Lady Mustang Invitational at Cypress Ridge Golf Club in Arroyo Grande. The Broncos' Annie Freman tied for second with a 3-over 147 total for the two-round event.
